technology: 1, There were no technical difficulties experienced by the participant.
cur_neg_affect: 1, The participant did not disclose any negative affect about the pandemic/masks/vaccine/boosters in the present.
past_neg_affect: 3, The participant disclosed some negative affect about the pandemic/masks/vaccine/boosters when recalling the past, such as having to quarantine and not being able to see friends.
communal_orientation: 4, The participant displayed some behaviors and made some statements that reflect a desire for social connectedness with their conversation partner, such as asking questions and listening attentively.
engagement: 6, The participant was engaged in the conversation, throwing themselves into the conversation and genuinely conversing with their partner.
defensiveness: 1, The participant was not at all defensive in justifying their beliefs/perspective.
questions: What was it like for you? [00:01:29]
Was it weird to go into work for an hour during the day? [00:04:02]
What was going through your mind when vaccines started to get rolled out? [00:05:54]
What was your experience kind of deciding about which vaccine and everything? [00:15:17]
similarity_statements: Like you said, the toilet paper craze and all just the mask craziness. [00:01:54]
Yeah, my parents were the same way, very strict about wearing a mask. [00:02:54]
vaccine_importance: 4, The participant believes that vaccines are somewhat important, as they got vaccinated but did not get a booster.
booster_importance: -1, The participant did not discuss the importance of boosters.
cognitive_complexity: 4, The participant demonstrated a moderate amount of cognitive complexity, considering different perspectives and recognizing nuance in the conversation.
general_notes: The participant is a young woman who lives in Nebraska. She works from home and did not have anyone affected too badly by COVID. She got vaccinated but did not get a booster.
